clinical_study.brief_title: Healthy Human Control Blood Collection for Validation of Biomarker Assay
clinical_study.official_title: Human Blood Collection to Serve as Negative Control for Validation of Circulating Tumor Cell Assay

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

brief_summary.textblock: Human blood will be collected to serve as control in validating clinical studies studying the detection and levels of circulating tumor cells and microvesicles in cancer patients. Targeted population is cancer-free 18-60 year old men and women. Volunteer selection will rely upon a short health questionnaire. About 20 mL blood will be collected from volunteers up to 20 different timepoints. The Procedure involves minimal risk of harm (eg discomfort, bruising) to the volunteer.

biospec_descr.textblock: About 20 mL blood will be collected from volunteers up to 20 different timepoints.

study_pop.textblock: cancer-free 18-60 year old men and women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age range: 18-60 years old Gender: Male and Female
Exclusion Criteria:
- No previously diagnosed malignancy Age: It is important to obtain a healthy, cancer-free volunteer population to serve as negative controls for this detection assay.
